clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of PlayStation Distraction in the Dental Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of PlayStation Distraction on Children's Behavior and Pain in the Dental Setting

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to assess whether the behavior, anxiety, and dental pain of pediatric patients during dental treatment improves when a video game is played as method of distraction.

detailed_description.textblock: global behavior Parental perception of patients' anxiety Patient's anxiety dental pain Heart Rate

primary_outcome.description: we will use the Frankl Scale

secondary_outcome.description: we will use the Modified Corah Anxiety Scale Questionnaire
we will use the Venham Picture Test
We will use the Wong-Baker Faces Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate during the treatment measures in different time points
secondary_outcome.description: We will use the the pulse oximeter

secondary_outcome.measure: Degree of acceptance of the distraction method by the pediatric patient
secondary_outcome.description: "Did you enjoy seeing the cartoon film during the dental visit?" (Yes/No)

arm_group.description: Patients will play a video game with Rimax® multimedia eyeglasses that occlude the environment partially during the second treatment visit.

intervention.intervention_name: Patients will play a video game with Rimax® multimedia eyeglasses that occlude the environment partially during the second treatment visit.
intervention.description: videogame can be considered as a method of distraction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 6-8 years.
- Patients who required a minimum of 2 visits for restorative treatment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with reduced audiovisual capabilities.
- Patients with psychological disorders.
